Comments_List: Ive learned to think about race and caste in so many different dimensions I had never even considered before.
I learned about racial formations and how they were informed by empire, colonialism, and other modes of the state in both the Caribbean and South Asia.
Comparisons of colonialisms across the British Empire. Some South East Asian studies, and some Black studies, including literature and theory.

So so much. This class fundamentally changed the way I interact with and think about the world. Hard to even begin describing it. Gives a powerful framework for thinking about category across time and space. Introducing new political modes of thinking about identity and solidarity.
The weeks cohered well so that topics introduced in once would be developed throughout the course in different contexts.
literally incredible. Great texts, and meeting speakers was so cool. At times, the reading load could be a lot, content pretty tricky. Would love to have a class like this that meets twice a week.
Definitely. One of the most intellectual enriching experiences Ive ever had
Yes! Love Prof Carby and Prof Grewal (and Hari!). Too bad they're all leaving :(
Yes. It is critical. Professor Grewal and Professor Carby are totally brilliant, but more than that, they actually act on the ideas and theory they read and develop. Really inspiring people.
Yes; if you are interested in thinking critically about race or caste and especially both, this is the best thing you can do for yourself.
